result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L. Walters

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew L. Walters in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Attorney Rivard states he was recently appointed and requests a new return date.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 10:14 AM- by Zoom) No appearance by Defendant Matthew L. Walters by Zoom or in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Matthew L. Walters.  Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense recently appointed. 
Hearing: 10/11/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Attorney Francis Rivard at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 08/19/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant needs to be fingerprinted. Defendant to apply to the SPD for an attorney. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/27/22 at 2:15 PM.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with D.H., Karl's TV & Appliance.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:23 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew L. Walters appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
State requests $1,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $500.00 cash bond with conditions.
